This 30th floor, four bedroom apartment has one of the most sought after outlooks on the Barbican Estate, with south and east aspects providing exceptional views over the river, St Paul's Cathedral, the London Eye and Westminster to the south and the City Skyline, Canary Wharf and the Barbican lakes and gardens to the east.   The reception room has been extended to encompass part of the external balcony creating a particularly spacious living and dining area.Internally, the apartment has been refurbished to a very high standard with wooden floors throughout, full height internal doors and two contemporary bathrooms, each with fitted storage. The hallway has a large coat cupboard and an additional cupboard with plumbing for a washing machine and separate tumble drier plus shelving and further storage above. A stunning Nicholas Anthony kitchen installed in May 2016 benefits from a sintered stone worktop, matt white and wood cabinets, Siemens induction hob, tiled splashback, Siemens dishwasher, and Miele ovens and warming drawer. There is also a walk in utility cupboard providing further excellent storage and a clothes drying area. All the bedrooms have windows looking towards Canary Wharf and beyond. The spacious master also benefits from a recently installed wall of fitted wardrobes and an en-suite shower room. It has a 24 hour porter.There is no onward chain with this sale.LeaseholdLauderdale Tower, Barbican, London EC2Y

This is a rare five bedroom house located in the heart of London's Square Mile, offering views of a lake, a portion of the ancient City walls and a 14th century church. This Grade II Listed Building is set within the private gated square of Monkwell Square. Entering on the ground floor, there is an entrance hall with fitted cupboards and a door to the integral garage with a utility area with taps and plumbing for a washing machine and a tumble dryer, and an entry-phone system controlled door to the square. On the ground floor there is a spacious bedroom, with mirror-fronted wardrobes, plenty of storage space and views of the old City wall (mostly medieval built onto Roman foundations).On the first floor the bedroom (currently used as a study) has its own terrace looking out on to the old City wall, the church and one of the Barbican lakes. There is a family bathroom on this floor, and a separate WC.Up another floor and there is a single and double bedroom overlooking the square with additional built in storage.On the third floor is one of the two spacious and bright living spaces. The lounge area offers lovely views of some of the stunning architecture nearby and has bespoke fitted cupboards.At the front of the house and up on a raised split level, there is the contemporary "Roundhouse" kitchen and dining space. The kitchen cabinets are cherry wood veneer with slate worktops, stainless steel splashbacks, an integrated dishwasher, Siemens double oven, combination microwave oven and hob with a freestanding American style fridge/freezer. The dining area overlooks the square.The master bedroom is situated on the fourth floor. On the landing before it there is an exit leading onto the Barbican Highwalk and a separate cloakroom. The master bedroom is fitted with Poliform wardrobes and bespoke Poliform furniture. There is a completely bespoke en-suite bathroom with a built in dressing table, mirror, vanity unit, two wash hand basins, WC, and a Daryl glass shower unit.Finally, at the top of the building there is a roof extension containing the second reception room which has a double aspect and doors on both sides leading onto pretty terraces. The South side terrace looks out to the City skyscrapers and down to Monkwell Square. The North side terrace offers lovely views of the lakes, City wall and St Giles church. These roof gardens have won a London Garden's Society gold medal in the past and are fitted with an automatic irrigation system. The top floor room also has a small kitchen area with a sink, fridge and the same cherry cabinets.There is a Linn hi-fi CD, DVD and speaker system cabled throughout the house along with wi-fi and an alarm.Location-wise, this generously proportioned house is in a superb spot for anyone wanting to be in the very centre of London. Within the Barbican itself is the world renowned Arts Centre with its concert hall, theatre, 3 cinemas, restaurant/bar etc., as well as the Museum of London. Within walking distance is both Clerkenwell and Spitalfields with their many shops, cafes and restaurants. St. Paul's Cathedral is around an 8 minute stroll away and Victoria Embankment and the Thames are also within striking distance offering walks along the river.For transport, the house is only a 6 minute walk from Moorgate tube station (Metropolitan, Circle, Hammersmith & City and Northern lines) or Barbican and St Paul's (Central line) stations. These are great hubs to have nearby as they connect so many areas of London and beyond. From here you are only two stops from London Bridge, which offers links to Gatwick airport and the south coast, two stops from King's Cross/St. Pancras which provide links nationally and internationally via the Eurostar terminal.Contemporary HouseFour / Five bedroomsTwo / Three reception roomsTwo bathroomsRoof terracePrivate parkingFirst time ever onthe rental market, this is a spacious townhouse in the very heart of the CIty.Wallside, City Of London, London EC2Y

Shackleton House is a newly built contemporary 2 bed apartment in a building at the quiet residential North end of Chalton Street, just off Euston Road between Bloomsbury/Kings Cross and Camden. Less than 500m from St Pancras International rail station, 700m from Kings Cross rail station and 600m from Euston rail station, it is also less than 500m from Mornington Crescent tube station and Camden High Street.External:The neatly detailed brick and cedar timber clad building has been designed meticulously by an award winning architect who has paid great attention to the all important details. The narrow frontage belies the depth and extent of the accommodation. To one side stands a 1930s mansion house and a brand new school gym the other. The school extends around to the rear.Property SpecificationEntrance:The front door is secured by twin latches. There is a digital keypad door entry system with colour video connecting the front door to each apartment. The common areas have durable low-maintenance wall and floor finishes.
